definitions.definition: A roundabout or indirect way of speaking; thus:

subdefinitions.definition: Unnecessary use of extra words to express an idea, such as a pleonastic phrase (sometimes driven by an attempt at emphatic clarity) or a wordy substitution (the latter driven by euphemistic intent, pedagogic intent, or sometimes loquaciousness alone).
Necessary use of a phrase to circumvent either a vocabulary fault (of speaker or listener) or a lexical gap , either monolingually or in translation .
examples: A technical word, such as hyperkalemia or hypoallergenic , can be glossed for general audiences with a circumlocution , such as "high potassium level" or "less likely to cause allergies" (respectively).

definitions.definition: An instance of such usage; a roundabout expression , whether an inadvisable one or a necessary one.

main_definition: ( uncountable ) A roundabout or indirect way of speaking; thus:
secondary_definitions: ( countable ) An instance of such usage; a roundabout expression , whether an inadvisable one or a necessary one.
